subject: Politics
title: Transitional Justice
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Transitional Justice.

hook.text: After a revolution, do you jail the old rulers or forgive them? The answer shapes a nation for generations.

buildup.text: Transitional justice addresses past abuses: trials, truth commissions, reparations, or amnesty.

discovery.text: Nuremberg trials after World War II set the precedent: leaders can be tried for crimes against humanity.

twist.text: Pursuing justice can destabilize fragile transitions. Old elites may sabotage change if threatened with prison.

climax.text: South Africa chose truth over punishment. Rwanda chose tribunals. Both approaches have strengths and deep flaws.

punchline.text: Justice and peace often conflict. New nations must choose which comes first.

quiz.question: What precedent did the Nuremberg trials establish?
options: That leaders can be tried for crimes against humanity
That all wartime leaders must receive amnesty
That international courts have no authority over heads of state
